etymologies: early 17th century (originally as tangara): from Tupi tangará, later refashioned on the pattern of the modern Latin genus name Tanagra

definitions: a small American songbird of the bunting family, the male of which typically has brightly colored plumage.

notes.text: Family Emberizidae (subfamily Thraupinae): many genera, in particular Tangara, and numerous species

shortDefinitions: small American songbird of bunting family, male
